title.narrative: Increasing women’s participation in local development and decision-making processes in 2 slum

description.narrative: This project will tackle issues of traditional gender stereotyping which often underpins gender inequalities and social exclusion experienced by 250 slum dwellers which in turn reinforces the high level of poverty among women folk and socially excluded population like people with disabilities (PWDs). These tendencies have developed into negative mindset and practices that often preclude women and PWDs from accessing empowering opportunities compared to their male counterparts. Views such as, “girls should be the only ones to cook,” “no need to spend on girl’s education because they will be married off to become another man’s property”, “a wife is the property of the husband,” “women are not supposed to own property,” “with no legs, you are but good for nothing” etc, are examples of these gender stereotyping which the project intends to address. These have led to the marginalization of women and PWDs

•Staff training on GESI concept and develop organisational gender policy: better understanding and application of this concept •Training of trainers in audio-visual techniques, policy literacy on the three gender acts, disability acts and youth policy: build capacity of 30 direct citizens targeted to replicate in their respective localities, through community-based mass sensitizations and other platforms which these citizens may be active in. •Collection and documentation of audio visual information 250 target cohorts or citizens: using photography and video recording to articulate their challenges, potentials and their aspirations •Organise seminars and roundtable discussion sessions: gives opportunity target participants (Mayor, Councillors, Development and Planning Officer, FCC social service department and key staff of Ministry of Social Welfare, Gender & Children’s Affairs) to directly engage with state and non-state actors to share their stories captured through audio-visual techniques which provides the anchor to discuss and demands rights and services that can address their circumstances which may include marginalisation and social exclusion.
